description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to excel to the next level of skills.
descriptionMD: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to excel to the next level of skills.
name: Excel 2016 Advanced for Mac
subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to excel to the next level of skills.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.616 --> 00:00:14.559
Hello everyone,
my name is Vaughn Smith, and

3
00:00:14.559 --> 00:00:17.432
welcome to Excel 2016 Advanced for Mac.

4
00:00:17.432 --> 00:00:20.249
In this course overview,
we're going to be going over, well,

5
00:00:20.249 --> 00:00:23.380
exactly what we're gonna cover
in this particular series.

6
00:00:23.380 --> 00:00:26.840
Who is the target audience, what you might
need to know before you get started,

7
00:00:26.840 --> 00:00:29.970
and any extra tidbits that I have for you.

8
00:00:29.970 --> 00:00:32.720
So we have three main
topics within this series.

9
00:00:32.720 --> 00:00:37.330
We have analyze data, graphical elements,
and collaborate and security.

10
00:00:37.330 --> 00:00:42.040
In the analyze data topics we're gonna
go over things that a lot of your

11
00:00:42.040 --> 00:00:44.380
Excel users are wanting to know about.

12
00:00:44.380 --> 00:00:46.080
Once you get past the, okay,

13
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:51.090
I know how to enter information in to
cells, now I need to analyze the data.

14
00:00:51.090 --> 00:00:55.900
I need to do things like sort and filter,
I need to do conditional formating,

15
00:00:55.900 --> 00:01:00.240
which is really cool to be able to pull
things out of it in a visual format sense.

16
00:01:00.240 --> 00:01:02.090
How do I make sub totals?

17
00:01:02.090 --> 00:01:03.940
How do I create outlines?

18
00:01:03.940 --> 00:01:09.520
How do I group different rows and columns
into making it a little bit easier for

19
00:01:09.520 --> 00:01:14.480
me to look at the data and be able to
make some determinations from that data?

20
00:01:15.550 --> 00:01:18.410
Formatting as a table,
one of my favorite things.

21
00:01:18.410 --> 00:01:20.890
I use tables all the time in Excel,

22
00:01:20.890 --> 00:01:23.740
I think it's probably one
of my favorite features.

23
00:01:23.740 --> 00:01:25.313
So we have some episodes on that.

24
00:01:25.313 --> 00:01:27.535
The What-If Analysis tools,

25
00:01:27.535 --> 00:01:33.262
this is where we're gonna go over
creating data tables, creating scenarios,

26
00:01:33.262 --> 00:01:38.402
and using the Goal Seek functionality
within that analyzing tool set.

27
00:01:38.402 --> 00:01:41.731
We're gonna consolidate data,
we're gonna remove duplicates, and

28
00:01:41.731 --> 00:01:44.540
we're also going to do
some advanced filters.

29
00:01:44.540 --> 00:01:49.594
Now, this particular series is not
going to be focused on performing

30
00:01:49.594 --> 00:01:53.878
calculations and
functions within our excel workbooks.

31
00:01:53.878 --> 00:01:58.475
Yes, we're going to allude to some of it,
you're going to see some formulas and

32
00:01:58.475 --> 00:02:00.504
functions within these files, but

33
00:02:00.504 --> 00:02:04.580
we're not concentrating on how you
actually create those functions.

34
00:02:04.580 --> 00:02:06.000
That's in a whole other series.

35
00:02:06.000 --> 00:02:11.180
It's really more of looking at your
data and be able to analyze it.

36
00:02:11.180 --> 00:02:13.140
Then we're gonna move on
to our graphical elements.

37
00:02:13.140 --> 00:02:15.540
This is where we get to talk
about pictures and shapes.

38
00:02:15.540 --> 00:02:18.220
You're gonna be like, but this is Excel,
Excel is more for number crunching,

39
00:02:18.220 --> 00:02:20.860
it's not for creating diagrams.

40
00:02:20.860 --> 00:02:27.280
But every program has this, and in Excel
you do have things like charts and

41
00:02:27.280 --> 00:02:33.330
diagrams that can really illustrate
your points within your information.

42
00:02:33.330 --> 00:02:38.450
Now, charts and graphs are in
another whole series as well.

43
00:02:38.450 --> 00:02:42.580
But the basics that you're going to
learn in this particular series,

44
00:02:42.580 --> 00:02:46.950
with, how do I create a circle, and fill
it in, and do all the different formats?

45
00:02:46.950 --> 00:02:51.140
That will apply over into
how you can format more

46
00:02:51.140 --> 00:02:55.232
advanced graphical elements, like charts.

47
00:02:55.232 --> 00:02:58.437
But we will get into
some SmartArt as well,

48
00:02:58.437 --> 00:03:03.425
really get your that all of
your office products have, and

49
00:03:03.425 --> 00:03:07.273
you could very well have
this in an Excel workbook.

50
00:03:07.273 --> 00:03:10.023
The we're gonna move on to collaborate and
security,

51
00:03:10.023 --> 00:03:13.080
where we're gonna collaborate and
listen with people.

52
00:03:13.080 --> 00:03:15.760
And we're going to go
over shared workbooks,

53
00:03:15.760 --> 00:03:20.110
the old shared workbooks,
we'll tell you about that.

54
00:03:20.110 --> 00:03:23.350
And how you can track changes in Excel.

55
00:03:23.350 --> 00:03:27.959
It's very similar to how you can
track changes in Word, but in Excel,

56
00:03:27.959 --> 00:03:32.803
it has a little bit different flavor
of how it actually, what it tracks and

57
00:03:32.803 --> 00:03:37.597
how you can look at those and accept and
reject those different changes.

58
00:03:37.597 --> 00:03:41.231
Then we have a little mini
series on co-authoring,

59
00:03:41.231 --> 00:03:45.290
again, more of our new ways
of being able to collaborate.

60
00:03:45.290 --> 00:03:50.775
And this is using our cloud services and
functionality of the Office

61
00:03:50.775 --> 00:03:55.240
365 applications, where we use our
OneDrive for business accounts,

62
00:03:55.240 --> 00:04:00.940
of saving files up into that location,
and being able to coauthor or

63
00:04:00.940 --> 00:04:06.050
collaborate in real-time with people,
and how that all works.

64
00:04:06.050 --> 00:04:09.040
We do have a couple episodes on
troubleshooting that because it's a great

65
00:04:09.040 --> 00:04:12.240
feature, but
it has a few little gotchas in there.

66
00:04:12.240 --> 00:04:16.430
So we go over hopefully all
the different factors and

67
00:04:16.430 --> 00:04:22.470
determinants that will maybe
make it not so easy at first.

68
00:04:22.470 --> 00:04:26.750
We'll also get into data validation,
a great way to control how

69
00:04:26.750 --> 00:04:30.250
other people might be inputting
information into your cells.

70
00:04:30.250 --> 00:04:35.850
So input masks, it's kind of
called that in other applications,

71
00:04:35.850 --> 00:04:40.020
such as Access, but in here were
gonna call it data validation.

72
00:04:40.020 --> 00:04:40.940
So good things there.

73
00:04:40.940 --> 00:04:43.280
We're also gonna get
into workbook security.

74
00:04:43.280 --> 00:04:47.290
We're going to be protecting our
worksheets, protecting our workbooks.

75
00:04:47.290 --> 00:04:50.130
Also putting on password protections for

76
00:04:50.130 --> 00:04:52.349
even opening the files or
editing the files.

77
00:04:53.570 --> 00:04:55.820
Then we end with document properties,

78
00:04:55.820 --> 00:05:01.540
understanding what that metadata that is
behind the scenes in all of your files.

79
00:05:01.540 --> 00:05:03.140
Actually, I forgot one thing on our slide.

80
00:05:03.140 --> 00:05:06.220
We have an additional topic, and

81
00:05:06.220 --> 00:05:09.930
the one episode that is in there
is the customized interface.

82
00:05:09.930 --> 00:05:12.780
And if ever we need to
add more information or

83
00:05:12.780 --> 00:05:15.250
additional topics, we'll go ahead and
put them in there.

84
00:05:16.390 --> 00:05:18.570
And then we move on to
our target audience.

85
00:05:18.570 --> 00:05:19.490
Who is this for?

86
00:05:19.490 --> 00:05:24.440
All Office users, capital O,
meaning you're using Office 365 suite,

87
00:05:24.440 --> 00:05:29.220
this is the locally
installed version of Excel.

88
00:05:29.220 --> 00:05:32.120
We do use Excel online a little
bit in the collaboration,

89
00:05:32.120 --> 00:05:35.020
but it is focused on Excel 2016 for Mac.

90
00:05:36.798 --> 00:05:40.950
And I would call this something
that is in Upper basics and

91
00:05:40.950 --> 00:05:44.200
wants to take up their skills
on to the intermediate level.

92
00:05:44.200 --> 00:05:49.350
Like, you have a couple base knowledge
of Excel, like I said, how to

93
00:05:49.350 --> 00:05:53.710
enter some data in there, and now you're
looking for how to really work with it.

94
00:05:54.710 --> 00:05:55.400
Things you need to know,

95
00:05:55.400 --> 00:05:59.180
you need to be familiar with
the Mac OS environment in the sense of

96
00:06:00.210 --> 00:06:05.790
opening files from your finder, knowing
where your doc bar is, those basic things.

97
00:06:05.790 --> 00:06:09.644
I already said, foundational knowledge
of Excel, you know how to move around,

98
00:06:09.644 --> 00:06:13.720
you know how to switch between open
workbooks, you know how to copy and paste.

99
00:06:13.720 --> 00:06:18.430
And familiarity with other Office products
is always helpful in any other Office

100
00:06:18.430 --> 00:06:23.221
product cuz if you know a little in one,
usually you can correlate it to the other.

101
00:06:23.221 --> 00:06:27.550
And always other options, yes.

102
00:06:27.550 --> 00:06:31.887
[LAUGH] What that means is
there's multiple ways to do

103
00:06:31.887 --> 00:06:35.150
the same functionality within Excel.

104
00:06:35.150 --> 00:06:38.940
I tried not to say functions because
that's a reserved word in Excel,

105
00:06:38.940 --> 00:06:43.460
but there's many different ways
to get to the same end result.

106
00:06:43.460 --> 00:06:46.940
And so if I'm doing it one way, there
might be another way of doing it, and

107
00:06:46.940 --> 00:06:48.920
that's totally valid.

108
00:06:48.920 --> 00:06:53.840
Updates happen, and man, they can mess
with you a little bit when it goes ahead

109
00:06:53.840 --> 00:06:55.940
and updates and
then your buttons move around, and

110
00:06:55.940 --> 00:07:00.480
things like the shared workbooks
doesn't exist anymore, really?

111
00:07:00.480 --> 00:07:03.750
It does they just took it away,
they took it off the ribbon.

112
00:07:03.750 --> 00:07:11.260
It's not in the actual menus, you have
to go hunt and pick it, so that happens.

113
00:07:11.260 --> 00:07:12.710
And always being able to search for

114
00:07:12.710 --> 00:07:17.000
answers using whatever
search engine that you want.

115
00:07:17.000 --> 00:07:20.870
You can find it, the Microsoft Help
files are always helpful, but

116
00:07:20.870 --> 00:07:25.800
there's tons of resources out there
to help answer your questions.

117
00:07:25.800 --> 00:07:27.820
Everybody uses Excel for
different reasons, okay?

118
00:07:27.820 --> 00:07:31.660
So I cover all the different
things that Excel can do.

119
00:07:31.660 --> 00:07:33.711
Some of it you might not have any use for,
and

120
00:07:33.711 --> 00:07:37.055
that's totally fine cuz we all use
it in a little bit different manner.

121
00:07:37.055 --> 00:07:43.620
But for the most part, in this episode and
in how we learn, have fun.

122
00:07:43.620 --> 00:07:47.740
Have fun learning,
follow along, and hopefully

123
00:07:47.740 --> 00:07:52.060
the learning will make using Excel more
fun, and you won't be as frustrated.

124
00:07:52.060 --> 00:07:56.349
So please stick around, and we'll see
you in some episodes very shortly.

125
00:07:56.349 --> 00:08:01.973
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne demonstrate how to analyze data using sort and filter functions in Excel 2016 for Mac. Sorting changes the order of all your data either by date, price, or alphabetically. Filter shows data based on your criteria. They also explore some more advanced techniques with custom sorts and custom filters.
episodes.title: Sort and Filter

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne explore conditional formatting which allows you to automatically apply formats to a cell or range of cells based on cell values. They demonstrate the different types of rules and how to customize formatting.
episodes.title: Conditional Formatting

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne explore using outline and subtotals in Excel 2016. Here you will learn how to work with outlines to create collapsible groups of rows and columns to show/hide your data as well as add calculated subtotals to properly sorted ranges.
episodes.title: Outline and Subtotals

episodes.description:
"In this episode, Daniel and Vonne examine working with data formatted as tables in Excel 2016. Here they will cover table formatting options, adding/deleting table rows/columns, adding a total row, removing duplicates, and converting to a range.
"
episodes.title: Tables

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel cover data tables, part of the What-If Analysis tools. Data tables can show different results of formulas by changing up to two variables.
episodes.title: Data Tables

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel discuss combining and summarizing data using the consolidate command. This can be used within a single worksheet or across multiple worksheets and/or workbooks.
episodes.title: Consolidate Data

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel examine scenarios in the What-If Analysis commands. Scenarios allow you to set up and save different values in cells and see how they can create different results in your formulas.
episodes.title: Scenarios

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel cover the last item in the What-If Analysis tool group - goal seek. Goal seek is used when you know the desired result of your formulas, but want to change one cell value to achieve that result.
episodes.title: Goal Seek

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel discuss how to remove duplicate data in three different ways:  using the remove duplicate command, conditional formatting, and advanced filters.
episodes.title: Remove Duplicates

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Daniel take a deeper dive into advanced filter options.
episodes.title: Advanced Filter

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne look at inserting and formatting shapes in Excel 2016. They demonstrate how to manipulate shapes by resizing, rotating, filling with gradients/colors, connecting shapes with lines, adding text, and editing points.
episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne show you how to add a pictures to your Excel 2016 spreadsheets. Here they will demonstrate inserting images from a file or Photos app, as well as resizing, rotating, and moving images. They also demonstrate how to use the format picture task pane as well as insert a screenshot and screen clipping.
episodes.title: Images: Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne dive deeper into working with graphics inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to format images by adding borders, effects, styles, image corrections, and artistic effects. They also show how to reset pictures, change pictures, and compress images. Finally, they demonstrate the remove background command and add alternate text titles and descriptions for accessibility.
episodes.title: Images: Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne continue working with graphics in Excel 2016. Here you will see how to select multiple shapes, duplicate, rotate, align, change stacking order, group/ungroup, and use the selection pane.
episodes.title: Arrange Images and Shapes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using SmartArt in Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to use SmartArt to more easily add a graphical element to your spreadsheets by giving you self-adjusting themes, text, and shapes.
episodes.title: SmartArt

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne will explore shared workbooks in Excel 2016. Here they cover the why and how of sharing workbooks as well as showing you what to expect when working with shared workbooks.
episodes.title: Shared Workbooks

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne dive into track changes in Excel 2016. Here they will explain why you would want to enable tracking and how to accomplish that. They also take you through the tracking process to help you understand how this may benefit you in your working environment.
episodes.title: Track Changes

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne show how to collaborate in real-time with co-authoring. This process involves saving a workbook to an Office365 OneDrive account and granting access to others.  They show the collaboration process from both the owner and recipient perspective.
episodes.title: Collaborate with Co-authoring

episodes.description: Co-authoring a workbook is a great collaboration tool. However, there are some nuances that can make the experience less than perfect. In this episode, Vonne and Justin review the requirements to co-author as well as how to reopen an shared document as an owner and recipient.
episodes.title: Co-authoring: Troubleshooting

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne continue to troubleshoot issues with co-authoring in Excel.  They talk about issues between co-authoring with users on a Mac and PC, why and how files will show a locked for editing error, and removing sharing through OneDrive settings.
episodes.title: Co-Authoring: Troubleshooting Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin take a closer look at version history when saving a document to a OneDrive account, the autosave feature, and how to open and restore versions. They also talk about some the interesting nuances of version history and how it creates versions.
episodes.title: Version History

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore implementing data validation inside of Excel 2016 for Mac. Here they will show you how to prevent erroneous data types from being entered by restricting the type of data that a user can insert. They also show you how to create custom error messages and highlight invalid data.
episodes.title: Data Validation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into workbook security in Excel 2016. Here they will show you security features like protecting workbooks and worksheets, locking and unlocking cells, and adding a password to open an Excel file.
episodes.title: Workbook Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne examine document properties of an Excel 2016 workbook. Here they will discuss the different properties and metadata as well as demonstrate how to add properties. They also show how to check accessibility.
episodes.title: Document Properties

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how you can customize the Excel 2016 interface to make it more efficient for your workflow. Here you will see how to customize the Ribbon and other options in Excel that can be manipulated for ease of use.
episodes.title: Customize Interface
